Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gigamesh the PoC would only be usable by a few developers, and they could point it at any coin they wanted. And even the coins that have "fixed" it, it costs less to attack them in fiat (not native coin) because of fiat prices of coins

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> take a minute to think of the implications of that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Woodchipper don't care if you "fixed" it. You just made it cost a tiny bit more, that is all.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Woodchipper don't care.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> https://i.imgur.com/U2cbxvP.gif

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> well, its your call

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Part of Zcash doing nothing is maybe realizing that all they can do is maybe make it cost 10-20X more, and that would cost them potentially hundreds of thousands of dollars in operational costs, to update the network. So maybe it raises the attack cost to $100/day to bring any Zcash protocol coin down. And what do they do then?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> theres enuff info in the CVE for someone to work out an attack anyway

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Just ignore the problem, spend the money, and keep paying Zooko's groceries, I guess

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gigamesh all the people that can easily attack ZEC are on the payroll

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> They don't want to destroy their paycheck

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Nor say a single thing, because the bossman controls their destiny

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> so the only mitigation against woodchipper is to effectively increase the cost of attack from $4/day to $100/day?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> so all Zcash forks r still screwed

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> ?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> now you get it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> The only solution is variable transaction fees, which Zcash is DEAD AGAINST

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> So I guess they would rather be trivially attackable

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Hush is migrating towards variable fees, just like BTC

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Why does anybody think BTC has variable fees? For funzies?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> For this exact fucking attack

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> how we gonna fix this in HUSH? variable fees?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> i thought that was already implemented

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> HushList protocol messages will NOT have variable fees, or will they?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> cant b good for the anon

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gigamesh what question are you trying to ask?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I feel like it's trying to come out

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and it's probably a good question

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> HushList protocol relies on a fixed default tx fee (0.0001) and a 0 value tx when sending messages to help protect a user's anonymity. Introducing a variable tx fee will therefor have a negative impact on the anonymizing power of the protocol.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> @dukeleto is this statement correct?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> the shorter form for the question is *Are we screwed*?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> lulz

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gigamesh HushList does not rely on a fixed default fee

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> HushList protocol is independent of amount or fee. You can use any values you want

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Miners decide which transaction fees to accept, nobody else

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Developers can only make the code possibly accept or deny some values that are too large or small, but ultimately, only the miners decide. And by that, I mean the largest mining pools, who usually have most of the deciding power

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Pooled miners decide nothing

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Only solo miners and pools decide

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> `Introducing a variable tx fee will therefor have a negative impact on the anonymizing power of the protocol.`

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gigamesh who told you that? Zcash company?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> If the entire network is using 0.0001 as a fee, and you, gigamesh start using 0.00001337 as a fee, that is really bad. REALLY REALLY BAD

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> It makes it obvious, "those are gigameshes transactions, with his elite fee"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Fees are always public, even in zaddr xtns.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> But if the whole network is using variable fees, then nobody stands out

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> It's only when you go against the stream, and make yourself stand out with completely unique fees, is when it's bad

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> If you want to pay a custom fee to make your fee go faster, Hush already supports that. It's just that our blocks are not full, and Hush mining pools haven't started to care about fee=0 xtns, yet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ZEC pools very much care, and will ignore you. And if your xtn is too big, they will even ignore your normal fee!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Zcash tells wallets to not allow people to control their fee, which is asinine. They want everybody to pay the same fee and that makes the woodchipper attack the worst. Nobody can pay extra fees to make their xtns go, if all the GUIs disallow it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I might have opinions about this topic

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> bbiab, I will let y'all digest all that üòÉ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> on reflection (havent had a coffee yet today) I am confusing a variable fee with a custom fee

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> custom fees ARE bad for anon right?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> those terms pretty much mean the same thing, but not exactly

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> only if the custom fee you choose is a unique number, is it actually "bad"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> like, if you choose 0.000015423534 as fee, that is really bad

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> choose 0.0002 instead

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> > only if the custom fee you choose is a unique number

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> most people just try to pay double fee, it's a common number on the blockchain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Unique numbers are not your friend, on the blockchain!!!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> is that not the definition of custom fee?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Changing the default fee from 0.0001 to ANYTHING else, means you are using a custom fee

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> custom = (probably) unique to user

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> You can use a custom fee of 0.0002, but that is a very common number on the blockchain. Using 0.000134555 would be a unique-ish number, and be very bad. Don't use special fancy fees, use common multiples of the default fee

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> "variable fees" means the way BTC does it, they charge you per byte of the transaction

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> exactly

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I am not sure we need that complexity, we can just have a simple way in the GUI to pay a double/triple fee to "speed up" your transaction, if needed

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> If you want to upload 200KB and only pay 0.0001 HUSH, it might take a long time for pools to add it to a block

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> But if you pay 0.0002 HUSH, maybe they add it the next block. Only mining pools decide

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and solo miners

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> pooled miners are just along for the ride

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> gotta go, will catch up later

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> miners determine "variable fees", users determine "custom fees". the former impacts all users in the same way, the latter not

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Miners decide which transaction fees to accept in a block

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> well if the wallet intelligently varies tx fees based on network conditions thats ok. if a user starts fiddling with custom fees, thats bad

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> @dukeleto fair?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <antropov083> @dukeleto why is the price of a coin so small? üò¶

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> lead dev cant really answer that imo

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> on the plus side it cant get much smaller

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AewNd29wRUM

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gigamesh a user needs to be able to decide "I want this to confirm as fast as possible" versus "I am ok with this taking a few hours" and the only way to do that is allow the user to choose a fee

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Also, under attack conditions, good users can always choose to pay more than the attacker, to have their transactions confirm faster. If you don't allow users that ability, the attacker wins by clogging up the pipes, and then normal users are unable to pay more fee to get more priority than the attacker xtns
